snippet: The Iowa Supreme Court ruled Friday that juveniles cannot be given mandatory minimum sentences.
abstract: Iowa Supreme Court rules that juveniles cannot be given mandatory minimum sentences, making it first state to interpret federal court directives that broadly.
lead_paragraph: The Iowa Supreme Court ruled Friday that juveniles cannot be given mandatory minimum sentences.

headline.main: Iowa: Mandatory Minimums for Juveniles Thrown Out
headline.print_headline: Iowa: Mandatory Minimums for Juveniles Thrown Out
